title: Advanced LLMs
subtitle: Reasoning, Agents, and the Structure of Intelligence
description: An advanced course that will dig deepet into the current trends in LLM development including reasoning and agents, and provide better understanding of the strengths and limitations of current AI.

instructor.name: Dr. Amir Sadovnik
instructor.bio: Dr. Sadovnik is the Research Lead for the newly established Center for AI Security Research (CAISER) at Oak Ridge National Lab. As part of this role, Dr. Sadovnik leads multiple research projects related to AI risk, adversarial AI, and large language model vulnerabilities.

learningOutcomes: Gain a deeper understanding of how LLMs operate including their strengths, limitations, and security risks.
Gain competence in using LLMs with common frameworks both locally and on the cloud
Understand the basics of LLM reasoning, hallucinations, and interpretability.
Understand and design LLM based autonomous agentic systems and using common frameworks.
Implement and benchmark LLMs on a novel task and right a academic level paper on you resutls.

policies.submission: All work must be submitted via Canvas. These will usually be by 11:59 PM EST on the due date. Late submissions will not be accepted. While some assignments will be independent others will be done in groups
policies.honesty: Students are allowed to use LLMs (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) as coding assistants, but must disclose their usage. Also, students must make sure they understand all code they have written. Plagiarism of academic papers or other students' work will result in immediate failure.
policies.attendance: This is a seminar-style course. Active participation is required. Attendance is expected. Please read all assigned papers *before* class.
policies.additional: Please make sure to find out the last day to drop/withdraw from the course if needed. For campus-wide policies on disability accommodations and mental health resources, please visit https://teaching.utk.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/78/2026/01/Campus-Syllabus-Updated-1-8-26.2.docx

assignments.title: Quizes/Exam
assignments.desc: Every few classes we will start with a few questions that'll cover last week's class. We will probably have a longer one later in the semester as well.

assignments.title: Final Project
assignments.desc: Novel research implementation or reproduction of a SOTA result. Groups of 3-4. Requires quantitative evaluation metrics.
